Articles.Content:
No, really that's what it's called

The game is simple:

Player A asks questions

Player B answers them

Rules:

Player A must not ask the same question twice

Player B must not use the same answer twice

How to play:

Answer the question of the person above you.

Ask a question for the poster below you.

Post Format:

answer to the previous question

your question for the next person

(a few line breaks)

All questions & answers used (copy from previous user)

Your answer and question

I will call a reset every now and then when the list gets too long.

What day is it?

One of them.

Which one?

The one happening right now.

Which one is that?

...

gogogo!

What day is it?

Edited October 20, 2015 by icantmakemodels

It's roughly day number 5,037,000,000,000.

What should I ask? (There are already forum games using this concept, BTW.)

Anything that hasn't been asked before.

What did you do in KSP today?

Improved my Kerbalized T-16 Skyhopper from star wars.

What is in my pocket?

Knife! No, Handses! String! Or... nothing!!

How much DeltaV is required to achieve Low Earth Orbit?

Rockets are more scared of you than you are of them.

James, while John had had "had," had had "had had"; "had had" had had a better effect on the teacher: is this true?
